summary: In this context, 1,1,2-trichloroethene (TCE) is mentioned in relation to the performance of a catalyst, specifically Cr1.0Cu0.5/SiCl4-Z, during temperature-programmed reduction (TPR) analysis. The study indicates that aging with TCE affects the reducibility of the catalyst's metal species, suggesting that TCE interacts with the catalyst, leading to changes in its chemical properties and performance. However, the details of this interaction are not extensively elaborated upon.
